intro: Olofuton racemosum, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Euphorbiaceae family.
